DONT download this. 

My AV progrma detects it as a Trojan:

spr/tool.wpakill.b.7

This is not a virus.  It's just that some anti-virus programs blacklist programs that defeat piracy countermeasures or other mischievous traits.  I have a thumb drive on which I keep Magical Jelly Bean Keyfinder which retrieves the Windows product key and product keys of other installed programs.  When I once stuck that thumb drive into a friend's computer, his Norton instantly scrubbed it off!  At least NOD32 Anti-virus lets you choose whether or not to delete a program or to de-blacklist select programs so your vast collection of hacker toys doesn't suddenly vanish into thin air.
